msItem.title: Diwan of Saif al-Din Isfarangi. (?)
msItem.note: Two facing pages in the middle have a number of seal impressions, largely effaced. Last folio, recto: a number of seal impressions around colophon, largely effaced. Last folio, verso: verses, notes of possession, one of Muhammad Ja'far, and seal impressions, including two of ... Shah Mir, dated 1109. Front flyleaf, recto: printed form for number filled in with 272 in European numerals and with 'Diwan-i Saif Isfarangi' in Persian. The name occurs in the colophon, but is evidently an alteration. Attribution needs to be checked. Many poems in praise of officials of Khurasan, e.g. Fakhr al-Mulk, probably later twelfth or early thirteenth century. Incomplete decoration. All headings left blank.

listBibl.bibl: These are not closely similar to the R.A.S. manuscript.

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather binding with blind-tooled decoration.

acquisition.p: Bequest of C.A. Storey, 1967. (See Digby ledger, p. 14.)

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
